newsitem.title: USA: Tenneco Louisiana pipeline hit by dredge.
newsitem.headline: Tenneco Louisiana pipeline hit by dredge.

text.p: The U.S. Coast Guard said a dredge struck a Tennessee Natural Gas pipeline shortly after 0500 CDT on Wednesday, igniting a fire and shutting the pipeline.
The fire was extinguished after the pipeline was shut, the Coast Guard said. There were no injuries or deaths reported.
The Coast Guard had no details on the volume of gas that moves through the pipeline. Tenneco officials were not immediately available.
The pipeline rupture ignited the Bean Dredging Co dredge Dave Blackburn and the tug operating it in Tiger Pass near the mouth of the Mississippi River south of New Orleans.
Tiger Pass is used mainly as a shortcut to the Gulf of Mexico for small supply boats and fisherman, the Coast Guard said.
